metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart topical greeting dialog. Contains all of her topical greetings. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BhrRB-K5Di1rQaNuyH43yRK6nsW22qNYYCPckybLaGI/edit#gid=824340093

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: It's about time Halsin actually stepped up and joined us properly - he's certainly been taking up space at camp for long enough.
0.context: NodeContext: Concerned. 'A crushing blow' = SH turned from Shar. 'I doubt I could go on' = SH loyal to Shar

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: Lae'zel has a dangerous look in her eyes - let's just hope she reserves those impulses for any common foes.
3.context: NodeContext: Concerned. 'A crushing blow' = SH turned from Shar. 'I doubt I could go on' = SH loyal to Shar

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: Mystra has forsaken Gale entirely. Imagine how he must be feeling... I doubt I could go on, if Lady Shar turned on me.
4.context: NodeContext: Concerned. 'A crushing blow' = SH turned from Shar. 'I doubt I could go on' = SH loyal to Shar

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: This place... there's a power in these shadows, I can sense it. It's ancient, familiar...

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: We're still in this fight. Time we got higher.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: I... I defied Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
11.context: NodeContext: Worried/can't believe what she just did (spared Nightsong). This occurs right afterwards while still in the Shadowfell, before the consequences of defying Shar have kicked in.

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: My orders were to keep the artefact safe, not pry into it... but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't curious as to what exactly it's hiding...
13.context: NodeContext: Quietly taken aback/unpacking what she's learned (dark urge player had in the past been a leader of the Absolute cult, but no longer remembers)

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: I thought I was the one most burdened with secrets - seems I was very mistaken. All this time we've been fighting and fleeing from the Absolute, and we've one of their figureheads in our midst.
14.context: NodeContext: Quietly taken aback/unpacking what she's learned (dark urge player had in the past been a leader of the Absolute cult, but no longer remembers)

264.speaker: Shadowheart
264.text: But I can hardly hold that against you - you seemed as surprised as I was. If you're able to resist your urges, then surely you can resist the lure of past allegiances also.
264.context: NodeContext: Quietly taken aback/unpacking what she's learned (dark urge player had in the past been a leader of the Absolute cult, but no longer remembers)

17.speaker: Shadowheart
17.text: The Gauntlet of Shar... I can't believe it. I can't believe we found the Dark Lady's sacred crucible.
17.context: NodeContext: A little overawed (may not actually be in the place she's referring to at the time)

363.speaker: Player
363.text: What did you think of it?
363.context: NodeContext: Awestruck by a Shar temple she entered (may not necessarily be in the place she's referring to at present) Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Overwhelming. Worship of Lady Shar is usually discreet by nature. Her holy sites have to be modest, well-hidden. But that place... I never knew such grandeur had been built in her honour.
36.context: NodeContext: Awestruck by a Shar temple she entered (may not necessarily be in the place she's referring to at present) Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: This is the place where you could become a Dark Justiciar. Your dream might soon be realised.

345.speaker: Shadowheart
345.text: I know. I can scarcely believe it's real, but I saw it with my own eyes, felt the polished stone walls raised in Lady Shar's honour...

188.speaker: Shadowheart
188.text: Normally it would not be for me to pursue becoming a Dark Justiciar without a superior's command, but this is different. My lady wanted me to find this place, I know it.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Tell me what you know of the place.

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: The Gauntlet of Shar is no ordinary temple - it is the highest test of the Dark Lady's faithful, to judge if they are worthy of becoming a Dark Justiciar.

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: The Gauntlet has double meaning - it speaks of the ordeals to be overcome, and of the armour-clad fist of Lady Shar that would embrace the worthy. Survive the crushing gauntlet, and be embraced by the Nightsinger at its very core.

257.speaker: Shadowheart
257.text: The old ways were lost over time - now some claim the rank simply by killing a single Selûnite. But before, they were a true elite. Many would attempt the trials, but few would succeed.

279.speaker: Player
279.text: These trials - need it even be said that you want to undertake them.

163.speaker: Shadowheart
163.text: It need not, indeed. I think you understand how important this is to me. I must prevail.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: That orthon lurking in the wings is formidable - we should be careful around him.
315.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Enough doubts have been sown throughout the narrative that SH is unsure if she can do what Shar wants (sacrifice Nightsong)

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: He slew Lady Shar's children - by rights I should avenge them and cut that ugly head right off his thick neck... but I'm no fool either. Picking a fight with him would be a distraction - a potentially fatal one.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I can't imagine you're too pleased to have the likes of Balthazar prowling around in there.
1.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Enough doubts have been sown throughout the narrative that SH is unsure if she can do what Shar wants (sacrifice Nightsong)

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.text: He's a pompous sack of spare parts. He and his undead lackeys should never have come here. Perhaps I can rid Lady Shar's gauntlet of them yet...

141.speaker: Player
141.text: We've made it to the Shadowfell - the very heart of the Gauntlet. How do you feel?
141.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Enough doubts have been sown throughout the narrative that SH is unsure if she can do what Shar wants (sacrifice Nightsong)

125.speaker: Shadowheart
125.text: Overawed, of course... but I have scarce time to saviour the majesty of Lady Shar's domain - there is yet work to be done, in her name.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: What will you do to the Nightsong?
165.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Enough doubts have been sown throughout the narrative that SH is unsure if she can do what Shar wants (sacrifice Nightsong)

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: I... I don't know. Lady Shar expects me to act without question... but I need to think. I need to be sure this is what I want.
42.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Enough doubts have been sown throughout the narrative that SH is unsure if she can do what Shar wants (sacrifice Nightsong)

255.speaker: Shadowheart
255.text: Whatever Lady Shar bids me to. I must not fail her now - not when I'm so close...

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: This place is quite something. I just hope it doesn't spring a leak.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: So Wyll's the Blade of Avernus now? I suppose that's a new sort of frontier for him.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: This place is like a glimpse into the future - no need to raise an army when you can just build one.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: Minthara is in Orin's clutches. Either we try to mount a rescue, or pay for her release with Gortash's life.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: The Shadowfell... this is Lady Shar's power in its purest form. Nothing can resist her will here.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: So that's how you win Mystra's forgiveness - self-sacrifice? I'm sorry, Gale. That can't be what you wanted to hear.
25.context: NodeContext: Supportive. 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. ''choice of goddesses' = SH is loyal to Shar

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.text: This is it... where I was raised, trained... hells, it's strange to be back.
27.context: NodeContext: Supportive. 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. ''choice of goddesses' = SH is loyal to Shar

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: Our new friend with the myriad limbs seems to know this route well. I just hope we can keep the ruse up once we reach our destination...
28.context: NodeContext: Supportive. 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. ''choice of goddesses' = SH is loyal to Shar

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: It doesn't seem so long ago that Minthara would have sought to kill us, and now we've welcomed her along. We're nothing if not magnanimous.
30.context: NodeContext: Supportive. 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. ''choice of goddesses' = SH is loyal to Shar

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: It seems Gale has made amends with Mystra. Good for him - though his choice of goddesses leaves something to be desired...
34.context: NodeContext: Supportive. 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. ''choice of goddesses' = SH is loyal to Shar

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Moonrise Towers... if this is indeed the very centre of the Absolute's schemes, then the source of our problem must be in here somewhere.
39.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic. 'I'm sorry, Gale. You tried' = SH turrned from Shar. 'She will rue the day' = SH loyal to Shar

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: I didn't think I'd live to see the day when Lae'zel turned her back on Vlaakith, but all things considered... good for her.
40.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic. 'I'm sorry, Gale. You tried' = SH turrned from Shar. 'She will rue the day' = SH loyal to Shar

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: 'The Blade of Frontiers'. Let's hope Wyll lives up to his name - we'll need all the help we can get.
41.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic. 'I'm sorry, Gale. You tried' = SH turrned from Shar. 'She will rue the day' = SH loyal to Shar

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: So, no deal with Raphael. I wouldn't want to give him the satisfaction, anyway.
45.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic. 'I'm sorry, Gale. You tried' = SH turrned from Shar. 'She will rue the day' = SH loyal to Shar

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: Mystra was never worthy of your devotion, Gale. She will rue the day she turned on you, I am sure.
46.context: NodeContext: Sympathetic. 'I'm sorry, Gale. You tried' = SH turrned from Shar. 'She will rue the day' = SH loyal to Shar

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: Jaheira's adept at keeping secrets - to conceal a family is no mean feat. Perhaps her skills lean more towards the Dark Lady than she realises...
50.context: NodeContext: Worried/can't believe what she just did failed to sacrifice Nightsong). This occurs right afterwards while still in the Shadowfell, before the consequences of defying Shar have kicked in.

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: I... I failed. I failed Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
52.context: NodeContext: Worried/can't believe what she just did failed to sacrifice Nightsong). This occurs right afterwards while still in the Shadowfell, before the consequences of defying Shar have kicked in.

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: We may need to increase our camp provisions now that we have Karlach along for the journey - those muscles don't run on fresh air, I'll wager. Still, she'll be useful in a fight.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: Seems like Wyll's a Grand Duke-to-be. I hope he remembers us little people, after he's ascended.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: Feels like we're nearly at the end, one way or the other...
61.context: NodeContext: A little nervous. History soon in the making.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: I'll miss Astarion... though perhaps my neck won't.

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: Jaheira must be tired - forced to prolong her duty, her life. No potential successor has met her standards, I suppose.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: It seems the githyanki are keen to reclaim the artefact I carry. I can't afford that to happen.

302.speaker: Shadowheart
302.text: In fact, none of us can. That thing is shielding us, somehow. I don't want to know what happens if we lose it.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You have the audacity to flaunt how you stole from my people? Perhaps I should surrender you and this artefact.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: I'll wager they'll thank you with a blade through the heart. You're tainted in their eyes, same as me. And your best chance is to stay close to the artefact.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: Let's not find out. We have enough to contend with already.
308.context: NodeContext: 'we'll cross that bridge when we come to it'

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: Agreed. There's not much we can do but press forward.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: There must be more to the artefact. You were sent to take it - you must know why it's so important.
15.context: NodeContext: 'we'll cross that bridge when we come to it'

276.speaker: Shadowheart
276.text: I only know what I know... I was ordered to retrieve it, and that's what I intend to do. The rest is immaterial to me.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: The artefact is shielding us, but ultimately, you wish to give it away? Something has to give.
186.context: NodeContext: 'we'll cross that bridge when we come to it'

356.speaker: Shadowheart
356.text: A problem for another time. Hopefully we'll no longer be in need of protection by the time my mission draws to an end.
356.context: NodeContext: 'we'll cross that bridge when we come to it'

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: Things won't be the same, without Astarion. At least he got to enjoy his moment of triumph... before we betrayed him.
70.context: NodeContext: Conflicted/thoughtful. She and the player sided against Astarion, who is now dead.

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: You accepted Bhaal, after everything we've been through? I can only hope this is part of some clever scheme I'm not privy to. Otherwise you might as well have stayed with the Absolute.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: Did you have any strange dreams of late...? Vivid ones?
73.context: NodeContext: Questioning/disquietened. Just had a very vivd dream

234.speaker: Player
234.text: It happened to you as well?

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: Damn. I was hoping my imagination had gotten the better of me, but this must be something more.

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: This... dream companion wanted me to use the tadpole - use its power. Whoever it was claimed to be an ally but... I don't know.

322.speaker: Shadowheart
322.text: It seems like we can't escape this mess, in the waking world or otherwise.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: Don't play coy. It happened to you as well, didn't it? It's all over your face.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: Those Gur Hunters made things difficult for themselves - they should really have tried to kill you before you became a vampire lord.
76.context: NodeContext: Referring to an ambush they repelled from their camp

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: We shouldn't have allowed the likes of Aradin to get the drop on us. Better be careful in future.
78.context: NodeContext: Referring to an ambush they repelled from their camp

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: It seems like Cazador used Astarion's flesh not as a canvas, but as a contract. We haven't heard the last of this, I'll wager.
81.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: Baldur's Gate... you know, I never quite believed I'd actually make it back. Wasn't until we got within reach of Wyrm's Crossing that it felt real.
83.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

304.speaker: Shadowheart
304.text: It's so strange - I don't remember much of it, yet I can't help feel like I know it. It feels like home.

359.speaker: Player
359.text: Glad to be back, I take it?

224.speaker: Shadowheart
224.text: I suppose I am. Though the chance to savour the moment might be brief, given all that still lies ahead of us.

180.speaker: Shadowheart
180.text: I may have to rely on your local knowledge, to plug the gaps in my own mind. Hopefully I'll remember more than I expect to.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Better than hating the place without remembering why.

275.speaker: Shadowheart
275.text: I suppose it is. Though the chance to savour the moment might be brief, given all that still lies ahead of us.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: Blessings from afar...? Perhaps Mystra is more invested in you than it seems, Gale.
85.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: I had another dream - which I suppose means you did as well.
86.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

194.speaker: Shadowheart
194.text: Whoever's reaching out to us truly does seem opposed to the Absolute - but wants us to embrace the tadpole? Venture right into the heart of the cult?

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: Perhaps we truly have a secret protector - or we're walking into a trap.

91.speaker: Shadowheart
91.text: You'd think I'd have more sympathy for someone trapped in a pod, but perhaps we should have left Mizora where we found her.
91.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: So Cazador saw fit to carve his ambitions right into your flesh, Astarion. If I was you, I'd return the favour with interest.
92.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: That face-thief Orin's made off with Gale. We'll need to rescue him... unless we actually intend to kill Gortash for her.
93.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: It was bad enough having just one of those tadpoles forced upon us. I can scarcely believe you actually inflicted another on yourself...
99.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: It seems you have made up with Mystra, Gale. Congratulations. Lady Shar has no love for your goddess... but I am glad you have someone to turn to.
100.context: NodeContext: Supportive 'Reconciliation' = SH turned from Shar. 'No love for your goddess' = SH is loyal to Shar

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: I suppose Astarion is a part of the vampire aristocracy now. I hope he doesn't expect us to bow to him.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: Orin's little display was just intended to rattle us. We mustn't let her succeed... but need to stay alert, all the same.

107.speaker: Shadowheart
107.text: We can't rely on the Harpers - not when Orin has them infested with shapeshifters. We're on our own - though I suppose we're used to it by now.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: Wyrm's Crossing. We could be inside the city walls before long... and I could be back where this all started.

109.speaker: Shadowheart
109.text: You couldn't resist the allure of the shadows, Gale? I don't blame you - it's the only power that truly counts.

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: Orin's made off with Yenna. Either we mount a rescue... or we win her freedom with Gortash's life.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: I think we've overstayed our welcome in this place - if we ever truly had one to begin with. We should leave.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: Those vampire spawn came for Astarion, didn't they? Lucky for him that we were here to fight them off...

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: The House of Hope - Raphael's abode. Only this time, he hasn't invited us to his table...

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: So, one dead devil, and you might learn something new about yourself, Astarion. Seems promising... if you trust Raphael, that is.

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: Shar did not come to Viconia's defence. All who bow to her are disposable pawns, in the end.

286.speaker: Shadowheart
286.text: Ironic. She tried to cling to Lady Shar's good graces, but that just hastened her downfall.

237.speaker: Shadowheart
237.text: She should have just obeyed - forgotten about the artefact. Then perhaps she could have still served the Nightsinger... under me, of course.

191.speaker: Shadowheart
191.text: The mission she sent me on was a lie - same as everything else she ever told me.

296.speaker: Shadowheart
296.text: She sowed her own downfall in trying to take the prism for herself. Had she never sent me, I'd still bow to Shar, none the wiser...

360.speaker: Shadowheart
360.text: Why the hells did she want the prism? It cost her everything.

313.speaker: Shadowheart
313.text: No matter. Her loss is my gain. Lady Shar wills it.

210.speaker: Shadowheart
210.text: No matter. I hope I never have to think of her again.

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: Poor Gale. To be abandoned by his goddess... I cannot imagine how that must feel. May the Dark Lady comfort him.

128.speaker: Shadowheart
128.text: This place is quite a find. Imagine all the people going about their lives, unaware of what their city has hidden away.

129.speaker: Shadowheart
129.text: I suppose not many can boast that they've been to a githyanki crèche and survived. Perhaps that's a good omen for our chances going forward, if you're feeling optimistic.

131.speaker: Shadowheart
131.text: So, Jaheira is willing to embrace mortality - the ultimate form of retirement - and that's thanks to impressing her through your actions. Quite the compliment.

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: That crèche would be a smoking ruin if it wasn't for us. Still, better move along - I don't want to test the limits of githyanki gratitude.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: So, the Stone Lord is Minsc, Jaheira's old acquaintance? Painfully small world, at times.

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: It feels like my entire world has been upended.

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: Lae'zel had better hope Vlaakith appreciates her loyalty. Otherwise, she achieved nothing but kill a potential ally.

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: So Gale's been walking around this whole time with some sort of magic bomb in his chest? I'm not normally one to begrudge someone their secrets, but that's something I should know...

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: We should be safe for the night now. Let's try and get some rest.
139.context: NodeContext: Referring to an ambush they repelled from their camp

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: I can't believe Mystra actually expects Gale to just sacrifice himself like that. Seems like a waste of a fine mind.

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: I didn't expect Lae'zel to turn on the Lich Queen so readily. Wonders never cease.

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: We've had a mind flayer whispering to us in our dreams all this time...? I really shouldn't be surprised by anything at this stage.

351.speaker: Shadowheart
351.text: Still... it seems keen to be an ally, in its own way. Compared to what we're up against, I'm not sure that's a bad thing.

148.speaker: Shadowheart
148.text: So Lae'zel remains loyal to her queen? She's consistent, I'll give her that...

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: Karlach and Wyll seem to have put their differences aside. I thought it was going to come to blows for a moment.

150.speaker: Shadowheart
150.text: This place seems remarkably tense for a sacred grove. Perhaps we shouldn't linger.

295.speaker: Shadowheart
295.text: But let's at least see if there's a healer to be found, first of all.

151.speaker: Shadowheart
151.text: It was no easy thing, overcoming those urges that gripped you. I'm not sure I would have managed, in your shoes. Well done.

158.speaker: Shadowheart
158.text: There's nothing like a stroll through some sewers to keep your sense of self-importance in check.

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: It can't have been easy, for Wyll to resign himself to the pact. But I'm glad he chose his father.
159.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. In the midst of a battle (though not in immediate danger)

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: If this place is as inviting as other aspects of githyanki culture, we'll be in for an interesting time, to say the least...
160.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. In the midst of a battle (though not in immediate danger)

164.speaker: Shadowheart
164.text: We need to keep pressing forward. The day isn't won until Ketheric Thorm has breathed his last.
164.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. In the midst of a battle (though not in immediate danger)

169.speaker: Shadowheart
169.text: So that's how you win Mystra's forgiveness - self-sacrifice? I'm sorry, Gale. That can't be what you wanted to hear.

170.speaker: Shadowheart
170.text: I thought this camp was supposed to be our safe haven - not quite so when we wake up to dead tiefling bards. I may have difficulty sleeping for a while...

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: I think I've had my fill of underwater misadventures. Let's get back to the surface world before any more perils seek us out.
173.context: NodeContext: Reflective. 'I would knoiw' = SH turned from Shar. 'I hope he does  not come to regret it' = SH loyal to Shar.

174.speaker: Shadowheart
174.text: The Netherbrain's lair must be close. This could all be over very soon, one way or another...
174.context: NodeContext: Reflective. 'I would knoiw' = SH turned from Shar. 'I hope he does  not come to regret it' = SH loyal to Shar.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: So, only a mind flayer can wield the stones, from what the Emperor said.
177.context: NodeContext: Reflective. 'I would knoiw' = SH turned from Shar. 'I hope he does  not come to regret it' = SH loyal to Shar.

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: We do have the Orphic Hammer. We could unleash Orpheus, let him wield the stones - provided we're willing to trust him.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny. I will not allow it.

216.speaker: Shadowheart
216.text: If you say so. But we still need a decision.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: So, the githyanki have no cure for our condition - unless you count death as a cure. I won't pretend to be surprised.
187.context: NodeContext: Reflective. 'I would knoiw' = SH turned from Shar. 'I hope he does  not come to regret it' = SH loyal to Shar.

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.text: 'Vampire Ascendant'. A fine prize, Astarion, paid for with a sea of blood. I'm glad to know I have an ally who understands the value of sacrifice - congratulations.
196.context: NodeContext: Reflective. 'I would knoiw' = SH turned from Shar. 'I hope he does  not come to regret it' = SH loyal to Shar.

198.speaker: Shadowheart
198.text: Gale defied Mystra herself. I hope he does not come to regret it.
198.context: NodeContext: Reflective. 'I would knoiw' = SH turned from Shar. 'I hope he does  not come to regret it' = SH loyal to Shar.

199.speaker: Shadowheart
199.text: I don't know how exactly Orin managed to spirit away someone as big as Halsin, but we have to get him back - either via a rescue, or Gortash's death.

200.speaker: Shadowheart
200.text: It seems that Wyll's determined to remain the Blade of Frontiers. I suppose he's truly earned the moniker, now.

201.speaker: Shadowheart
201.text: Poor Karlach. All this way, just to be faced with a dead end - literally. I can't imagine how she feels.

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: What happened to that magical item, Gale...?

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I don't want to talk about it.

314.speaker: Player
314.text: I consumed it - I had no choice.

203.speaker: Shadowheart
203.text: Gale, you truly thought to turn to shadow magic, after seeing how it has ravaged nature? Your ambitions are... disquieting.

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: This place makes my skin crawl. Don't take anything for granted in here.
204.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Zevlor's mutilated corpse was discovered

206.speaker: Shadowheart
206.text: This is it. Win or lose, the fate of the city - of everything - is going to be decided here.
206.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Zevlor's mutilated corpse was discovered

208.speaker: Shadowheart
208.text: Gale's back on his feet - good. We've got enough problems as it is without him dead as well.
208.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Zevlor's mutilated corpse was discovered

212.speaker: Shadowheart
212.text: Minsc - he seemed to believe that doppelganger was truly Jaheira. A sure sign he's being manipulated.
212.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Zevlor's mutilated corpse was discovered

213.speaker: Shadowheart
213.text: I know you have your personal demons to contend with... but if I didn't make it clear before, I think you can beat this. Just don't give in, and seek help if you need it.
213.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Zevlor's mutilated corpse was discovered

214.speaker: Shadowheart
214.text: A cruel end. I wouldn't have wished that for Zevlor, no matter his failings.
214.context: NodeContext: Sombre. Zevlor's mutilated corpse was discovered

215.speaker: Shadowheart
215.text: We're in decidedly unfamiliar territory now - keep up the pressure, and stay alert. We need to find Thorm.

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: Astarion. You seem remarkably hale and hearty, in spite of all we're facing. The itinerant lifestyle must suit you.

221.speaker: Shadowheart
221.text: An imposter in our ranks... if this is true, it could be anyone. You, me... well, not me - I know who I am.

144.speaker: Shadowheart
144.text: Perhaps we shouldn't take Gortash's word for granted... but if he speaks the truth, we need to be careful. Orin could have eyes and ears on us right now.

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: Karlach's temper is a sight to behold. She'll need to be careful, or that rage will burn her right out.

225.speaker: Shadowheart
225.text: The shadows are losing their grip on these lands - Shar can indeed be thwarted. Comforting to know.

227.speaker: Shadowheart
227.text: We need to make a decision - if anyone's to become a mind flayer, perhaps it should be Karlach. She's doomed either way.

230.speaker: Shadowheart
230.text: This isn't over yet - we need to pursue Ketheric Thorm.

231.speaker: Shadowheart
231.text: So, only a mind flayer can wield the stones, from what the Emperor said.
231.context: NodeContext: 'callous logic' = SH has turned from Shar. 'The dark lady would approve' = SH is loyal to Shar

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: Karlach has offered to take on the duty. She doesn't have much time left, so there's a certain logic in leaving this to her. The Dark Lady would approve, I'm sure.
117.context: NodeContext: 'callous logic' = SH has turned from Shar. 'The dark lady would approve' = SH is loyal to Shar

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: But let us not forget that we also have the Orphic Hammer. We could free Orpheus, let him wield the stones - if we can trust him.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: It will be me. I'll become illithid. I'm not afraid.

343.speaker: Shadowheart
343.text: If... if you're sure. This is not a decision to make in haste, but you have my support, either way.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: I spoke to Karlach already - I agreed to let her transform. This is what she wants.

277.speaker: Shadowheart
277.text: Very well. Let's do all we can to help her.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I don't want this for Karlach; I won't allow it.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: I see... then I hope she understands. But I trust your judgement.

239.speaker: Shadowheart
239.text: Whatever you choose to do, you can count on my support.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny. I will not allow it.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: I understand your determination. But we still need a decision.

267.speaker: Player
267.text: None of us are about to turn into an illithid. I shall give the stones to the Emperor.

90.speaker: Shadowheart
90.text: If you think that's for the best... but I just hope the Emperor doesn't betray our trust.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: We have the hammer - now is the time to use it. We'll release Orpheus.

333.speaker: Shadowheart
333.text: Very well. Whatever happens, I shall stand by you.

238.speaker: Shadowheart
238.text: That's Orin dealt with - good riddance. Now that we have her Netherstone, we're one big step closer to finishing this, once and for all.
238.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

240.speaker: Shadowheart
240.text: Just our luck to find an inn, only for it to be burning to the ground.
240.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

241.speaker: Shadowheart
241.text: Wyll sacrificed his own father... I hope freedom from the pact is worth it to him.
241.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

245.speaker: Shadowheart
245.text: An infestation of vampire spawn - that's just about the last thing I wanted to wake up to. We thwarted their efforts to seize Astarion, at least.
245.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

246.speaker: Shadowheart
246.text: This place seems ancient. It must predate everything on the surface. I wonder what it was like in its heyday.
246.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

247.speaker: Shadowheart
247.text: We can't just let Orin take one of our own - even if it's Lae'zel. We have to rescue her... or kill Gortash in order to win her freedom.
247.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

249.speaker: Shadowheart
249.text: I'll never be able to look at a butcher shop again after this place. But at least we were afforded a soft landing.
249.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

250.speaker: Shadowheart
250.text: Defying a goddess, Gale? Bold, but Mystra was never worthy of your love.
250.context: NodeContext: A little surprised. 'imitation is a form of flattery' = SH turned from Shar. 'Never worthy of  your love' = SH loyal to Shar

254.speaker: Shadowheart
254.text: I can't believe Mystra actually expects Gale to just sacrifice himself like that. Seems like a waste of a fine mind.
254.context: NodeContext: Poo-scraper is an in-game dagger. Anger/empathy for Wyll

256.speaker: Shadowheart
256.text: So Cazador wishes to ascend at Astarion's expense? Somehow I can't see our fanged friend accepting that meekly.
256.context: NodeContext: Poo-scraper is an in-game dagger. Anger/empathy for Wyll

258.speaker: Shadowheart
258.text: I never thought I'd see the Gauntlet of Shar for myself. In fact, part of me wondered if it was actually real.
258.context: NodeContext: Poo-scraper is an in-game dagger. Anger/empathy for Wyll

259.speaker: Shadowheart
259.text: The Orphic Hammer is ours - which means we could free Orpheus, if we wish.
259.context: NodeContext: Poo-scraper is an in-game dagger. Anger/empathy for Wyll

260.speaker: Shadowheart
260.text: I'm sorry that happened to you, Wyll - that bat-winged slattern deserves to meet the business end of a poo-scraper.
260.context: NodeContext: Poo-scraper is an in-game dagger. Anger/empathy for Wyll

287.speaker: Shadowheart
287.text: But if it's any consolation, the new look is rather rugged...

262.speaker: Shadowheart
262.text: The Underdark... as if we didn't face enough dangers back up on the surface.
262.context: NodeContext: Anger/empaty for Wyll, though she also likes the horns.

270.speaker: Shadowheart
270.text: I can't believe Mystra actually expects Gale to just sacrifice himself like that. Seems like a waste of a fine mind.
270.context: NodeContext: Anger/empaty for Wyll, though she also likes the horns.

271.speaker: Shadowheart
271.text: So, a deal's been struck with Raphael at least. He certainly drew out his sales pitch for long enough.
271.context: NodeContext: Anger/empaty for Wyll, though she also likes the horns.

273.speaker: Shadowheart
273.text: I hope Mizora flies into the blades of a windmill for what she did to Wyll... though I must admit the new look is a little dashing...
273.context: NodeContext: Anger/empaty for Wyll, though she also likes the horns.

274.speaker: Shadowheart
274.text: So Astarion didn't fulfil his master's ambitions for himself. At least that means he's his own man... though I'm a little surprised he didn't covet those powers.
274.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

282.speaker: Shadowheart
282.text: Minthara with child... Somehow I can't picture her sitting around the campfire, knitting baby booties...
282.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

283.speaker: Shadowheart
283.text: Boo seems like a worthy addition to our group. His pet, Minsc, may prove useful also.
283.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

285.speaker: Shadowheart
285.text: This land remains cloaked by Lady Shar's power - good. A shame it cost us Halsin as a travelling companion though. He may have been misguided, but I liked looking at him.
285.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

290.speaker: Shadowheart
290.text: That's the last of Raphael. I'll be glad to no longer have to suffer his smug face.
290.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

291.speaker: Shadowheart
291.text: Not the cheeriest of inns, this place. But I suppose the mortal peril lurking just past the firelight is liable to put a dampener on the mood.
291.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

293.speaker: Shadowheart
293.text: Minsc is dead, Jaheria is gone... We've lost ourselves some powerful allies, I fear. Let's just hope we still have enough strength to see this through.
293.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

294.speaker: Shadowheart
294.text: Poor Karlach. She can finally seek out the touch of another... only to be told she might not have much time left.
294.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

297.speaker: Shadowheart
297.text: The crèche... it's nothing but rubble and ashes now. We should put some distance between ourselves and this mess, before any githyanki come investigating.
297.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

298.speaker: Shadowheart
298.text: That drow, Nere, is going to be on his last gasp unless someone digs him out. Though not necessarily our concern, of course.
298.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

300.speaker: Shadowheart
300.text: It seems like Wyll and Karlach will play nice from now on. Saves us having to pick sides.
300.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

305.speaker: Shadowheart
305.text: We need to make a decision - and you becoming a mind flayer seems like the least-worst option, unfortunately.
305.context: NodeContext: Some outrage. A great sacrifice is being asked of the party.

307.speaker: Shadowheart
307.text: Most would think us mad for wandering right into the middle of a goblin war clan... I suppose that goes to demonstrate just how desperate we are.

310.speaker: Shadowheart
310.text: So Gale just consumes magical items like I do wine? We truly are a group apart...

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: Nevertheless, as quirks go, that's a new one for me.

331.speaker: Shadowheart
331.text: I just hope he's able to keep his hunger in check.

317.speaker: Shadowheart
317.text: Gortash is no more - and he was kind enough to bequeath his Netherstone to us. We might yet manage to pull this off.

318.speaker: Shadowheart
318.text: Astarion's an interesting find. Let's hope any future acquaintances don't hold a blade to your throat by way of introduction.

319.speaker: Shadowheart
319.text: So Lorroakan covets Dame Aylin? He'll live to regret that, once we inform her.

324.speaker: Shadowheart
324.text: I can't believe Mystra actually expects Gale to just sacrifice himself like that. Seems like a waste of a fine mind.

325.speaker: Shadowheart
325.text: Lorroakan's pride took a beating, to learn his prize was beyond reach.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: Though not half so bad as the one he'll take, once we tell Dame Aylin of his plans.
43.context: NodeContext: Anti-Shar path, amused relish at what an angry Dame Aylin will do to Lorroakan

328.speaker: Shadowheart
328.text: This place reeks of madness and murder - I can almost feel it in the rotten air.
328.context: NodeContext: 'WTF...?' - the universe keeps throwing her curveballs, and this latest one is a doozy

335.speaker: Shadowheart
335.text: I've heard you can't get blood from a stone, but apparently you can get a wizard from one. Gale seems interesting.
335.context: NodeContext: 'WTF...?' - the universe keeps throwing her curveballs, and this latest one is a doozy

336.speaker: Shadowheart
336.text: Bloody hells - literally. Just when I think I've got a grasp on our dilemma, a devil shows up...
336.context: NodeContext: 'WTF...?' - the universe keeps throwing her curveballs, and this latest one is a doozy

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: No matter. We've dealt with every other oddity thrown at us lately - we can handle this one too.
38.context: NodeContext: Working past her surprise. Time to buckle down and deal with the situation (overture from a devil)

368.speaker: Shadowheart
368.text: He knows our secret, he claims he can help... what do you make of him?

272.speaker: Player
272.text: Help is help, no matter the source.

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: Oh you were tempted, were you? Interesting.

229.speaker: Shadowheart
229.text: What grabbed you, exactly? His parlour tricks? His manners? The lavish spread, even?

332.speaker: Shadowheart
332.text: You must have found something alluring, to overlook the fact he was a devil.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: If Raphael can truly offer help, we have to at least consider it.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I'm still unsure. He could be a help to us, or not.

299.speaker: Shadowheart
299.text: You know, failing to make a decision is the same as making a decision...

161.speaker: Player
161.text: Actually, if Raphael can truly offer help, maybe we should consider it.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: All right. Perhaps we shouldn't trust Raphael. He is a devil, after all.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Use your shared connection. Find out what she's thinking.

193.text: *Anticipation. She is testing you somehow. About Raphael.*

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *Anticipation. She is testing you somehow. About Raphael.*

252.speaker: Player
252.text: What's your point exactly? Spit it out.

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: My point is that Raphael was stirring the pot - trying to unsettle us.

154.speaker: Shadowheart
154.text: Hmm. Or is it? Suddenly I'm not so sure...

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: ... isn't it terrible when someone causes you to doubt yourself?

323.speaker: Player
323.text: I've changed my mind. Perhaps we should trust Raphael.

209.speaker: Shadowheart
209.text: Your opinions are easily swayed. Should I wait for them to change again?

349.speaker: Player
349.text: No. My mind is made up.

89.speaker: Shadowheart
89.text: Perhaps you're right. Perhaps a devil has our best interests at heart and wants nothing in return.

329.speaker: Shadowheart
329.text: We could throw ourselves at his feet - be they cloven or otherwise. Or perhaps we shouldn't.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: My mind is settled. Raphael could be just the friend we need.

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: Your gullibility would be endearing, if it didn't lead us into danger.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You're twisting my words - trying to manipulate me.

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: Bravo - you had me worried for a moment.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I'll admit it - I don't know what to do.

347.speaker: Shadowheart
347.text: Clearly. And do you know what? I think that's just what that devil intended.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: I've changed my mind. We shouldn't trust Raphael.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Use your shared connection. See what she's really thinking.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Seems like you have a particular point you want to make about Raphael.

288.speaker: Shadowheart
288.text: Actually... yes, you're right. Very intuitive. Clearly the devil was trying to sow doubt among us.

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: He's clever. My order uses the same tactic when dealing with enemies of Shar.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: I know people who work much like our new acquaintance does.

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: You don't need a scourge or a rack to break people. Fear and self-doubt are sufficient.

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.text: When actual pain comes, the victim's already done the heavy lifting for their torturer.

228.speaker: Shadowheart
228.text: There were no right answers with that devil. He was toying with his food - us.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: I'm glad I made the right decision then.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm glad you saw his ploy for what it really was.

289.speaker: Shadowheart
289.text: See? Sowing doubt is an old trick. Watch out for it. And for Raphael.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: Who the hells are these people you know, who do such things?

168.speaker: Shadowheart
168.text: Cunning people. Private. And very dangerous, at times. Perhaps you'll meet them one day...

367.speaker: Player
367.text: So who are Shar's enemies? Who receives this treatment?

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: There are many. But they all renounce their gods when they are taught fear.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I didn't realise you were so... well-versed in mental and emotional torment.

211.speaker: Shadowheart
211.text: And aren't you glad that I am?

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: It's an effective trick. Watch out for it. And for Raphael.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: I think I detected a note of admiration in your voice.

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: I respect his craft. As should you.

178.text: ...agh! I can feel you - get out of my head!

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: ...agh! I can feel you - get out of my head!

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: I don't know what's worse. A devil or a prying leader.

339.speaker: Shadowheart
339.text: I expect we'll be parting company very soon.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: Do that again and I'll leave you to bleed out in this wilderness, understand?

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: And watch out for Raphael. He's better at getting into people's heads than you are, you ass.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: You're obviously toying with me. Stop it.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Use your shared connection. Listen to her thoughts.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Actually, I've changed my mind. A devil such as Raphael can't truly be trusted.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: I must admit, I'm feeling less sure all of a sudden.

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: I've made you doubt yourself. Sorry, not what I intended.

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: Let's take time to think about it. Some food and rest, things will be clear then.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: I'm not going to just change my mind. We can't trust Raphael.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: Good. That's what I wanted to hear.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Enough about me. What do you think is best?

153.speaker: Shadowheart
153.text: I'll tell you in due course. I just wanted to see how close we are in thinking, first of all.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: Use your shared connection to hear her thoughts.

306.speaker: Shadowheart
306.text: I suppose it was a lot to take in. A devil sought us out, teased us with his help...

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: ... but he also stared as if we were the banquet, rather than the one on the table.

268.speaker: Shadowheart
268.text: We can't hedge our bets here. Best we decide how to deal with him, if at all.

344.speaker: Player
344.text: He's a devil. We shouldn't trust him - simple as that.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: No doubts at all? He seemed powerful and very knowledgeable about our problem...

244.speaker: Shadowheart
244.text: Not the worst prospect we've stumbled across. As long as you can look past what he is...

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Use your shared connection to read her thoughts.

340.speaker: Shadowheart
340.text: I thought perhaps you'd be tempted to seize Cazador's prize in his stead... but you didn't. Pity - a vampire lord would have been a fine ally... but no matter. It's done.

348.speaker: Shadowheart
348.text: Mizora is no more... but we sacrificed Wyll along with her. The Hells have him now.

354.speaker: Shadowheart
354.text: It seems even the Lord of Murder has lost faith in you. I'd offer my commiserations, but, well... I think they might be lost on you.

355.speaker: Shadowheart
355.text: A lot of people died because you lost the run of yourself. Isobel shielded them from the shadows - and you left them vulnerable.

113.speaker: Shadowheart
113.text: If you can't control yourself, you're nothing but a liability.

357.speaker: Shadowheart
357.text: A vampire nest - you truly can find everything in the city. I'd better keep my throat protected...

358.speaker: Shadowheart
358.text: I hope that amulet proves to be worth it...

361.speaker: Shadowheart
361.text: The decision is made - no point in regrets now. Let's keep going.
361.context: NodeContext: Empathy/hint of gallows humour at the end.

362.speaker: Shadowheart
362.text: That Orphic Hammer could be crucial... we may have to try and get our hands on it.
362.context: NodeContext: Empathy/hint of gallows humour at the end.

364.speaker: Shadowheart
364.text: Wyll ought to know what happened with Mizora. Whatever she has in store for him can't be good.
364.context: NodeContext: Empathy/hint of gallows humour at the end.

365.speaker: Shadowheart
365.text: Poor Karlach, having to face her own mortality in such a... definitive manner. Though the rest of us are still liable to perish, if it's any consolation.
365.context: NodeContext: Empathy/hint of gallows humour at the end.

366.speaker: Shadowheart
366.text: What delightful circumstances we find ourselves in.

369.speaker: Shadowheart
369.text: That... creature you turned into. I hope you have it under control. It didn't look like something I'd want to contend with.
369.context: NodeContext: Apprehensive. Player transformed into a large monster previously
